evidence.source_document: Complaint For Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In early April 2025, ICE began a sweeping and unexplained pattern of terminating the SEVIS records of international students without notice, justification, or individualized process. These terminations have affected hundreds if not thousands of students nationwide, regardless of whether they had any adverse immigration or criminal history.

extracted.value: ICE terminated SEVIS records of hundreds of international students without notice or due process, causing immediate departure requirements, loss of educational opportunities, and harm to academic and professional standing; plaintiffs include students with clean records affected by terminations based on dismissed arrests or no criminal history.

evidence.text: Defendants’ failure to provide any process prior to the deprivation of this interest—no notice, no hearing, no opportunity to rebut—violated the Due Process Clause of the Fifth Amendment.
